  • public class PlayerTweener
extends Player

    • Field Detail

      • updatePlayers

        public boolean updatePlayers
        Indicates whether to update the Player instances this instance is holding. If this variable is set to false, you will have to call Player.update() on your own.

      • baseBoneName

        public java.lang.String baseBoneName
        The name of root bone to start the tweening at. Set it to null to tween the whole hierarchy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerTweener

        public PlayerTweener(Player player1,
                     Player player2)
        Creates a player tweener which will tween the given two players.
        Parameters:
        player1 - the first player
        player2 - the second player

      • PlayerTweener

        public PlayerTweener(Entity entity)
        Creates a player tweener based on the entity. The players to tween will be created by this instance.
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity the players will animate

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Tweens the current set players. This method will update the set players if updatePlayers is true.
        Overrides:
        update in class Player
        Throws:
        SpriterException - if no bone with baseBoneName exists

      • setPlayers

        public void setPlayers(Player player1,
                       Player player2)
        Sets the players for this tweener. Both players have to hold the same Entity
        Parameters:
        player1 - the first player
        player2 - the second player

        public Player getFirstPlayer()
        Returns the first set player.

        the first player

        public Player getSecondPlayer()
        Returns the second set player.
        Returns:
        the second player

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(float weight)
        Sets the interpolation weight of this tweener.
        Parameters:
        weight - the interpolation weight between 0.0f and 1.0f

      • getWeight

        public float getWeight()
        Returns the interpolation weight.
        Returns:
        the interpolation weight between 0.0f and 1.0f

      • setBaseAnimation

        public void setBaseAnimation(Animation anim)
        Sets the base animation of this tweener. Has only an effect if baseBoneName is not null.
        Parameters:
        anim - the base animation

      • setBaseAnimation

        public void setBaseAnimation(int index)
        Sets the base animation of this tweener by the given animation index. Has only an effect if baseBoneName is not null.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the base animation

      • setBaseAnimation

        public void setBaseAnimation(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the base animation of this tweener by the given name. Has only an effect if baseBoneName is not null.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the base animation
